data.title: List of Playtone films
data.meta_description: The list "Playtone films" has been viewed 42 times.
data.text:
The Polar Express 2004 animated film directed by Robert Zemeckis

0 0

Genre: Animation, Adventure, Family, Fantasy

Director: Robert Zemeckis

On Christmas Eve, a young boy embarks on a magical adventure to the North Pole on the Polar Express, while learning about friendship, bravery, and the ... more »

The Polar Express is a 2004 American computer-animated adventure film co-written and directed by Robert Zemeckis, based on the 1985 children's book of the same name by Chris Van Allsburg, who also served as one of the executive producers. The film features human characters animated using live-action motion capture animation. The film tells the story of a young boy who, on Christmas Eve, sees a mysterious train bound for the North Pole stop outside his window and is invited aboard by its conductor. The boy joins several other children as they embark on a journey to visit Santa Claus preparing for Christmas. The film stars Tom Hanks, who was also one of the film's executive producers, in multiple distinct roles, with Daryl Sabara, Nona Gaye, Jimmy Bennett and Eddie Deezen in supporting roles.

2004 3D films · 3T

2000s English-language films · 4,356T

Uncanny valley · 6T

Mamma Mia! 2008 American romantic comedy musical movie directed by Phyllida Lloyd

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Romance, Music

Director: Phyllida Lloyd

Writer: Catherine Johnson

The story of a bride-to-be trying to find her real father told using hit songs by the popular 1970s group ABBA. more »

Mamma Mia! (promoted as Mamma Mia! The Movie) is a 2008 romantic comedy film containing music directed by Phyllida Lloyd and written by Catherine Johnson based on her book of the 1999 theatre show of the same name. The film, in turn, is based on the songs of pop group ABBA, with additional music composed by ABBA member Benny Andersson. The film features an ensemble cast, including Christine Baranski, Pierce Brosnan, Dominic Cooper, Colin Firth, Amanda Seyfried, Stellan Skarsgård, Meryl Streep and Julie Walters. The plot follows a young bride-to-be who invites three men to her upcoming wedding, each one with the possibility of being her father. The film was an international co-production between Germany, the United Kingdom, and the United States, and was co-produced by Playtone and Littlestar Productions.

The Ant Bully 2006 American computer-animated film

0 0

Genre: Animation, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy

After Lucas Nickle floods an ant colony with his water gun, he's magically shrunken down to insect size and sentenced to hard labor in the ruins. more »

The Ant Bully is a 2006 American animated fantasy film written and directed by John A. Davis and based on the 1999 children's book of the same name by John Nickle. Starring the voices of Julia Roberts, Nicolas Cage, Meryl Streep, and Paul Giamatti, it was produced by Tom Hanks and Gary Goetzman's Playtone, Davis and Keith Alcorn's DNA Productions and Legendary Pictures, and distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures.

2006 3D films · 6T

Films about ants · 12T

2006 comedy films · 451T

Cast Away 2000 American adventure drama film directed by Robert Zemeckis

0 0

Genre: Adventure, Drama, Romance

Director: Robert Zemeckis

A FedEx executive undergoes a physical and emotional transformation after crash landing on a deserted island. more »

Cast Away is a 2000 American survival drama film directed and produced by Robert Zemeckis and starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, and Nick Searcy. Hanks plays a FedEx employee stranded on an uninhabited island after his plane crashes in the South Pacific, and the film depicts his desperate attempts to survive and return home. The film was released on December 22, 2000. It grossed $429 million worldwide, with Hanks nominated for Best Actor in a Leading Role at the 73rd Academy Awards.

Films about sole survivors · 6T

Films produced by Robert Zemeckis · 23T

2000s American films · 7,187T

Where the Wild Things Are 2009 fantasy drama film directed by Spike Jonze

0 0

Genre: Adventure, Drama, Family, Fantasy

Director: Spike Jonze

Yearning for escape and adventure, a young boy runs away from home and sails to an island filled with creatures that take him in as their king. more »

Where the Wild Things Are is a 2009 fantasy film directed by Spike Jonze. Written by Jonze and Dave Eggers, it is based on Maurice Sendak's 1963 children's book of the same name. It combines live-action, performers in costumes, animatronics, and computer-generated imagery (CGI). The film stars Max Records and features the voices of James Gandolfini, Paul Dano, Lauren Ambrose, Forest Whitaker, Catherine O'Hara, and Chris Cooper. The film centers on a lonely boy named Max who sails away to an island inhabited by creatures known as the "Wild Things," who declare Max their king.

English-language German films · 842T

That Thing You Do! 1996 film

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Drama, Music

Director: Tom Hanks

Writer: Tom Hanks

A local Pennsylvania band scores a one-hit wonder in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as they can, with lots of help from their manager ... more »

rank #7 · 71 10

That Thing You Do! is a 1996 American comedy film starring, written and directed by Tom Hanks, in his directorial debut. It tells the story of the rise and fall of a fictional 1960s one-hit wonder pop band, and it also stars Tom Everett Scott, Liv Tyler, Johnathon Schaech, Steve Zahn and Ethan Embry. The film also resulted in a musical hit with the titular song of the same name, which was nominated for an Academy Award and a Golden Globe Award for Best Original Song.

1990s American films · 4,707T

Films shot in Erie, Pennsylvania · 7T

My Life in Ruins 2009 film by Donald Petrie

0 0

Genre: Comedy, Romance

Director: Donald Petrie

Writer: Mike Reiss

A disgruntled tour guide in Greece gains an unexpected new outlook on life thanks to one of the people on what she intends to be her last tour. more »

My Life in Ruins (UK title: Driving Aphrodite) is a 2009 romantic comedy film set amongst the ruins of ancient Greece, starring Nia Vardalos, Richard Dreyfuss, Alexis Georgoulis, Rachel Dratch, Harland Williams and Alistair McGowan. The film is about a tour guide whose life takes a personal detour, while her group gets entangled in comic situations among the ruins, with a series of unexpected stops along the way. The film was released on June 5, 2009 in the United States, and May 7, 2009 in Greece.
